intro: Rotheca ternifolia, commonly known as the three-leaved rotheca, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are opposite and three-lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. Rotheca ternifolia is often found in open woods and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
